Reviews.Title: “Stevie 5”
Reviews.Author: Steven G
Reviews.Content: have just returned from a three night stay at the Giotto hotel, we found this hotel very good value for the price and although the hotel was full we where not disturbed by any noise, the staff were very friendly and helpful,the only complaint if there is one was the lack of tourist information on offer.the metro is only a 10 minute walk and for 4 euros you can buy a ticket for a day, there is also a nice little cafe just across the road serving decent Italian food at very reasonable prices. All in all very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Group Holiday”
Reviews.Author: M D
Reviews.Content: Getting a group of 16 adults organised into a hotel is not an easy feat. Mr Berni, the manager co-ordinated the whole thing with military precision. Communication in English was excellent and the staff is conversant in other languages. The staff were excellent hosts and attended to all our needs. Altough the rooms are small, they were clean and clean linen and towels provided daily. The breakfast was of a good standard. Hotel transport arranged by the manager was on time, very efficient and of the highest standard. The hotel is close to the Metro but buses are closer (bus 49). I strongly recommend Hotel Giotto.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Beefylad
Reviews.Content: We found the reception staff very friendly. As everyone else commented, the rooms are very cramped and odd shaped, but you are in ROME and shouldn't be spending any time in your room other than to sleep! So much to see and do. Giotto is a decent enough base. The walk to the Metro is about 10 mins and the perfect way to get around Rome. Day tickets are 4 Euros and a one way ticket was 1 Euro. Bargain! The coach from the airport was 6 Euros one way. Breakfast was fine. Bit disappointed regarding the lack of toast, but I wouldn't have expected a banquet with the price we paid for our room!! You pay for what you get and I think Hotel Giotto is a great budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hmmmm....ok u have passed”
Reviews.Author: tro954w
Reviews.Content: ...if you want a clean ...very cheap.....bed and breakfast base camp for your trip to Roma ....this odd shaped, very round hotel, is your best bet! yes the rooms are small ...but as we paid hardly anything for it ..so what ! no u could not spend much time in the room before getting sympathy notes from Terry Weight ..so what ..ya in ROME FGS ! bathroom was small .....what are you planning to do in it ? transport is easy to access ..49 bus every 15 mins hotel staff very nice breakfast ok ..take some breakfast rolls they are free...and EVERYTHING in Rome cost £12 If you are going to Rome this is the best budget hotel you can get ...want a bigger room? pay another £100 for ya stay ...simples = 0

Reviews.Title: “lovely week in Rome Hotel is not the best.”
Reviews.Author: MNJDIABATE
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week in Rome staying at the Giotto Hotel, when we arrived we were put on the 6th floor in what can only be described as a glorified cupboard, the room had a double bed a TV that was at least 20 years old, and 3 dreadful channels. We spoke to the reception staff and they agreed to move us the next day. We were then moved to the 3rd floor to a bigger and better room, still a shame about the TV, but at least we could get the BBC world service... the room was adequate and the bedding and towels were changed daily. The shower and Bath were not the best and there was quite a bit of mould as the window overhangs the bath. Beware of the lifts if you don't like small spaces as they are only big enough for one. Also be aware the hotel is very noisy, lots of students stay here, and I don't know who georgie was but they need to get him and alarm clock as someone was banging on his door every morning at 5am for half an hour trying to wake him up. Breakfast was adequate but very boring with no hot food at all not even toast. Also the only healthy option was cornflakes. There is a supermarket just up the road from the Hotel where you can buy fresh fruit and yoghurts. Advice in general, the easiest way to get to the hotel from the airport is to get the Blue Cotrail bus outside of the airport to the last stop which is Cornelia ( underground station) it cost 3.50 euro's unlike the directions the hotel gave us which cost us 10 euro's each. Once you get off the bus at the final stop, walk past the bus terminal which is in the middle of the road on the left hand side, you will see a newspaper stand walk behind that (opposite the petrol station) and then carry on, up the left hand side. Walk up the road you will see a sign for the Giotto Hotel carry on until you see a carpark (for the supermarket) on the left, walk past the carpark and turn left, cross over onto the right hand side of this turning, you will see a small parade of shops and a news stand take the second right there is a small parade of shops, and you will see the hotel down the street on the left side. Getting around Rome is easy from the hotel go to the Tabbach shop and but a bus ticket they are 1 euro each and last 75 mins, walk back to the supermarket car-park and you will see the bus-stop, get the 49 if you want to go into cenral rome, you need to change to the 492 at the stop past the Vatican. if you want to visit the Vatican then I would advise going in the afternoon as it is very busy in the mornings. Food and drink are very expensive in the centre of the town, we bought drinks and snacks near the Hotel and then had picnics next to some of the beautiful fountains (Trevi) is stunning. Rome itself is beautiful, there is loads to see, we walked most of the time as each street has something to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: DonovanL_12
Reviews.Content: With our trip to Rome we pre-booked our room from South Africa and with great dissapointment we arrived at Giotto and was cramped up like sardines in a tin! We requested a bigger room and was only helped the next day! Its not as close as they say on the internet from the Metro... Breakfast was included but nothing special! Ordinary and exactly the same each day!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Jo F
Reviews.Content: My partner booked the hotel Giatto in Rome for me as a valentines surprise in Feb 2012. The pictures on the website make it look like a lovely place to stay but do not be fooled, the hotel looks nothing like the pictures. It was dirty, smelly and run down. The rooms are very small, i have a bigger bedroom at home in a 2 bed apartment!! The bathroom has clearly never been cleaned properly as the taps were green and there was mould all around the bath. The shower was hanging off the wall, the toilet seat was cracked and the window was full of water between the glass. The double bed was 2 single beds put together and was very uncomfortable. There was heating in the room which luckily in ours it worked but many others were complaining about having to sleep in their coats as hotel staff wouldnt let them change rooms. The breakfast was cheese, meet, bread roll and stale croissants, no fresh juice and they serve cold water for a cup of tea. The bar hardly had a choice a drinks. The hotel staff were very unhelpful, rude and ignorent and every single time we went to the room we had to go back to reception to get the key card reset. The reception area looks quite nice but the rest of the hotel is old and dark but apparently it has just had a referb....dont think that is true!! Around the hotel is run down appartments, graffiti all over the walls, damaged cars and to top it all off you have a 10 - 15 minute walk along a rather busy road to reach the metro before you can get to the centre of Rome. We spoke to a a few different people staying in the hotel and all were very unimpressed...like us they booked online thinking the oictures looked lovely and were all very disappointed when they arrived. The hotel was so dirty the heating systems were blowing out dirt and dust which made a lot of people ill including myself. Also what you arent told is that they use this hotel for students on a regulary basis so you end up with a lot of noise and excited children running around at all hours of the night and the staff are unwilling to tell them otherwise. I wouldnt recommend anyone stay here even if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Too far”
Reviews.Author: graduate19
Reviews.Content: This hotel is far to far away from the main attractions of Rome. To get there you have to walk to the local Metro station which is about a 15 minute walk away, down a steep hill and along a busy main road that dosen't have any pavements, so you are walking in the road trying to dodge the traffic.After a full day of sightseeing there is the prospect of the return journey on the metro and a walk up a steep hill which is fine if you are young and healthy.The hotel is also used by many foreign school parties so was quite noisy during the night. On the plus side it is clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. I would say that this hotel was more suitable for the young.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveljunkie034
Reviews.Content: Having stayed many places throughout Italy and in Rome, Hotel Giotto was by far the least desirable and least accommodating. Extremely far and inconvenient location; it took us up to an hour each way to get to and from the Rome city center. The address is located on a different street than the hotel was actually located, so we were walking around in the rain pulling luggage looking for an incorrect address. The staff was cold and minimally helpful. Our room was the smallest room I have ever stayed in in Europe, the shower was located OVER the toilet, and the breakfast was a joke (dried, old croissants). I would NEVER recommend someone to stay at the Hotel Giotto. Avoid at all costs.....you have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Try elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: e l
Reviews.Content: European hotels are clearly rated on a different star system. We used TripAdvisor to see the comments regarding this hotel prior to our trip and we held our breaths regarding what to expect. The comments did not disappoint! (Trust me I've been to developing countries and their hotels were better than this one and I am not a fussy traveller.) I also realize that while one really does only sleep in the hotel and spends the remaining time sightseeing this hotel really wasn't that comfortable. This is a BUDGET hotel, which may be suitable for school age students who are on their first trip to Europe or on a band trip. The hotel is showing its age, and the pictures on its website: http://www.hotelgiotto.eu/en/photo-gallery.php might have been taken last decade. The chambermaids and cleaning staff tried their hardest to keep it clean. We had a room which had a shower that backed up and the cleaning crew was sent to unclog the shower in the middle of the night. The cupboard to hang clothing was filled with five mismatched clothes hangers. The walls were very thin we could hear the tv and conversations of the room occupants next door crystal clear. Like the hotel's website states: the hotel is in a quiet residential neighbourhood. I am from a big city and there is a difference between a "quiet residential neighbourhood" and one that is what we call "suspect." This one was suspect. The hotel's proximity to public transit is a good 10 minute walk through an alley way and a very tight tight sidewalk to get to the main road where the bus stop is. The Vatican City is a good 45 minute bus ride from the hotel. The Corneilia Metro station is10-15minutes by bus and the bus stop is not the easiest to find once you exit the Metro Station (via the Aurelia Street exit). The kicker however was the "stellar" front desk customer service. We asked the front desk agent how long it would take to reach the airport from the hotel and how much it would be to hire a taxi to take us to the airport on the day we were departing. He was clearly on the computer messaging a friend. He took the time to finish typing his response before acknowledging us and then stated with a smirk "Well, there's always traffic in Rome." I really wanted to say "no SH@T! Sherlock" but I held back. In Summary: Pros: -Bed Bug Free! (I think crossing fingers thus far!) -Basic Breakfast -Has a refrigerator -clean towels and hot water Cons: -Dreadful customer service -Old plumbing -Funky musty smell -Cigarette burns in the curtains -Distance from transportation Summary: Pay the extra money and stay closer to the centre of the city. This was little better than a side of the freeway pay by the hour motel.

Reviews.Title: “A trek but not terrible”
Reviews.Author: staticeva3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Giotto in December. Don't think that because it's "near the Vatican" that it's close to most things in Rome. It's the last stop off the subway line, and then there's a 15 minute walk (if you're young and fit) up a hill to get there. It wasn't terrible, but I can easily imagine that if you get tired of walking easily (especailly if you've been walking everywhere in Rome) you might find staying there a challenge. Other than the location, we had no complaints about the hotel. Some highlights/bonuses include: -They have a roof (5th floor) you can walk out on (at least we did) which gives a nice view of -the city (we drank a bottle of wine!) -They let us print out a car confirmation for free -The vending machine sells water cheaper than any convenience store/restaurant we encountered -The bar is well stocked and dirt cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I Have Ever Walked In To...”
Reviews.Author: chase11mckmck
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for us by an online travel agent as part of a 3 city tour of Italy. The hotel in Venise was good, the one in Florence was ok but borderline, this one was disgusting. So much so that my mother and I checked in and then checked out within 10 minutes - no joke. We walked upstairs and the room was bare bones (no big deal - you are there to see Rome, right? Not the accomodations), the real issue was with the smell. It stunk of flea powder - it was.....extremely unpleasant. Other contributing factor to this bad review of Hotel Giottto...location. To get to this hotel from Termini (the central Metro station and also the rail station) we had to (1) take Metro to very last stop, (2) walk a block and take bus 5 stops, then (3) walk a quarter of a mile. Not what I call "centrally located". If we had stayed here I can't imagine how much of our days would have been spent traveling to and from the sites rather than actually enjoying them! Final contributing factor to this bad review - person at the front desk was not friendly to us. Isn't that when you would think they would be the most friendly to their guests? When they just walk in your doors?? Ugh, overall just a really gross hotel and I am so glad we made the decision to turn around and walk out!

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: Irishguide
Reviews.Content: Stayed her from 27 Nov to 30 Nov 2011. The hotel was clean and reception staff very helpful.Our room was at the front of the hotel and was quite noisy .The breakfast wasn't great just one meat and one cheese available and white rolls/ croissants. The fruit juice was from a machine not fresh and the fruit salad was tinned. It is about a 15 minute walk from the metro station ok on the way down but quite a hill on the way back up.Nice cafe facing the hotel and staff there very friendly. Not a lot to do or any shops in the area immediately around the hotel.Overall not a bad choice for the price but I would prefer something more central.

Reviews.Title: “What do people want”
Reviews.Author: jaspercatYorkshireuk
Reviews.Content: After reading the bad reviews about the hotel we were in trepidation. What a pleasant surprise. The room was basic yes and a little dated with age showing around the bathroom mirror, but spotlessly clean with crisp white sheets and towels which were changed every day.We asked a maid for extra pillows and they were there straight away. Our room was quite large and a place for our case to sit although we spoke to people who said their room was small but again spotlessly clean. There was a plentiful supply of shampoo/body wash and for a basic hotel we found no problems realy. We were out every day straight after breakfast because come on we were in Rome and wanted to see all the sights. The hotel is a little way from the centre but just a few minute walk away we could buy bus/metro tickets for 1 euro and we found it quite easy to get to the centre by metro or bus. The staff were very friendly and polite and whenever we asked them anything they were happy to help. Several people said the bar/cafe across the road looked a dive and uninviting, well we went in every night and found the owner delightful and eager to help. We ate the first night there as very tired and had basic pasta and pizza which were hot and tasty. Each night after that when we had walked our legs off exploring the delights of Rome we called in there for a couple drinks and a snack. Once again the lady owner was very friendly and happy to oblige. The drinks and food was resonably priced and cheaper than many places in town. We would recomend it for sure. On the whole we could not find a lot of fault with the hotel exept maybe the breakfast could be a bit more exiting. We did though find plentul cereal, coisants, bread rolls and cheese and meats and fruit. A basic breakfast but enough to start the day, again all spotlessly clean.One thing was the coffe was not good but a trivial point. What more could you want from a basic cheaply priced hotel. Unless of course you go on holiday to spend all day in a hotel room which makes me wonder is some of the reviewers do. We would go back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from Hell”
Reviews.Author: Anon R
Reviews.Content: This was possibly one of the worse hotels I stayed at. I was unfortunate enough to have to spend five nights here with my husband who struggled to get any sleep. The walls were wafer thin and very noisy, we could hear everything going on in the corridors and rooms next to us. The breakfast was so terrible that I opted to starve. The hotel staff were extremely rude, I remember waiting at the front desk to ask a question while the male receptionist stood right in front of me chatting away on the phone. I waited patiently for 5 minutes and he looked straight at me and continued his phone conversation, laughing out loud and not even offering an apology. After about 10 minutes I gave up and went up to my room. It is a cheap hotel but I would rather have forked out a bit more for a decent nights sleep and good food.

Reviews.Title: “A good comment!”
Reviews.Author: HolaLondon
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Rome yestrerday. The hotel is very clean and nice. The people writing bad comments on here are people who most properly spend all their time in a hotel room. If you are someone who always stays in 4 to 5 star hotels then it is not rocket science that this is going to be a bad place to stay. The staff in this hotel were friendly and very helpful, the rooms are very clean. There were three missing tiles of the bathroom but i did not loose any sleep over it and you are not in Rome to look at the 4 walls. The hotel is on line A, the last stop. At first i thought we were far out but after jumping on the bus 49 (outside the hotel) i realised we were not that far out. You walk everywhere in Rome so you end up walking the whole of Rome everyday. In London 20minutes seems a long time but in Rome you feel so relaxed you forget about the time. We had 5 days and did everything. This is a good cheap hotel that we enjoyed. Breakfast: You are in Rome so therefore it is bread, cheese, ham, croisants and coffee. Not many places do a hot breakfast. I enjoyed the breakfast, it was all fresh. There were lots of schools from England staying here too. I felt very safe and wouuld go back again

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Hollysnoz Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Staff not very friendly! Rooms clean but could do with updating. Breakfast very basic, couldnt even get a hot cuppa tea! Was told the hotel is near to Vatican - this was not the case - 20 minute walk to metro and then another 20 to 30 mins on the metro to reach the citry! Hotel obviously used for lots of college students consequently it was very noisy, even had to complain on last night to receptionist! Would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “According all posts before is very good price/value”
Reviews.Author: Silfax
Reviews.Content: I red almost all reviews of this hotel before our stay, so I was really nervous what is waiting ... And my decision after stay is : this hotel is no 3 stars hotel, hotel is clean and staff is friendly and if you want something, they are trying to help,you should use PC with internet near reception, room was standart, two air-cindition, small fridge, TV (poor programs) (we have type with 4 bed, so room wasn´t spacy) bathroom have typical accesionaries (soap,shampoo,big and small towels,hair-dryer), shower was good and I hadn´t any problems with water pressure or temperature (but we were in the ground near reception). Breakfast was cold (2 type of salami, 1 type of cheese, butter, jams, sweet roll, salty roll and different types of cakes like croissant etc., cornflakes, fruit, hot drinks and soft drinks are operated by your own in automat - juices but so sweet for me, so reduced by water is neccesary) .You can eat all and how long you want. We have one problem with locking our room, lock didn´t want to lock after closing door, so you have to insert entrance card and didn´t open door, after that is was OK. It´s not good location for guests with car, local buses (49,994) go about 200 meters from hotel in average every 5 minutes, after 4 stops you will be on Cornelia metro station). We hadn´t problems with noise in the night and city quatter looks very safe. Oposite hotel is local bistro and 100 meters local shop with foodstuff and tested restaurant :-)

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: S_ren_LCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: On arrival, we were told that we had not ordered double rooms, even though our voucher clearly indicated so. We got a lame explanation about the difference in twin bed and double bed rooms. One of the couples (we were three) had to spent the first night in two single rooms. The receptionist ensured that it was only for the first night, so we accepted. The next afternoon, when we wanted to change the two single rooms for a double, as promised, it was refused as this should have been requested before breakfast!!! After some hazzle and yelling, we eventually got the room we had ordered from the start. The rooms were ok, a bit small, but nice and clean. The bathrooms were not up to par though; the shower arrangement had several design flaws, which resulted in wet floors and uncomftable use. The breakfast is just for survival until you get to the city centre; very basic and a terrible coffee! The area around the hotel was nice and safe, a small cafe across the street, sadly not the best place to eat; prefabricated pizza's - in Rome! A few hundred meters from the hotel was a couple of restaurants, one of them very nice. Transport to city centre was ok; 5 min. to busline 49, going directly to the Vatican, or metro taking you anywhere in Rome. Considering that price is much cheaper than a central hotel, hotel Giotto is ok, a few notches on the staff friendliness would improve the general impression a lot though.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my time and would use it again”
Reviews.Author: Isadora l
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice secluded area, with some places to eat that are local. My first impression was a bit worrying at first but the manager who I have named Gio(not his real name of course) was very pleasant considering the room booked was incorrect, he dealt with this immediately and was very polite throughout my stay. As some people have mentioned before the area is quiet and some of the local restaurants were close as it was during the time some of the locals go on holiday but otherwise transport into town was easy and lots to do around Rome and plenty of places to eat although they do tend to help themselves to tips without it being offered, and the people came across as being unsociable. the local restaurant across the road from the hotel serves basic meals and would only recommend the pizza, not much choice of meals, but there is another restaurant around the corner which has a good menu but when we went and ordered meat dish they only had 1 steak n the menu everything else was pasta or fish. went during 17th August and it was extremely hot sometimes unbearble, but have the air condition in the room when we returned to our hotel was a relief, and staff in the hotel were approacable and plesant.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER NEVER NEVER”
Reviews.Author: ya_liberrr
Reviews.Content: I, alas, had to reserve this hotel on booking.com. On responses it wasn’t absolutely clear that it from itself represents. We’ll begin that it, REALLY, is located so far from main sights. If you don't have car be going to spend DAILY 50-60 euros for a taxi there and back. Near to hotel - passing a part, nearby isn't present either normal shops or restaurants. In a word, forget about pretty Rome and prepare for "dormitory area". At first sight, foretells nothing troubles. The young Italian from reception works unwillingly, but works (being in passing picked a nose). My passport have taken away at once and have asked to retain till next day (that, of course, wasn't pleasant to me, after all it is possible to copy and give at once). It was necessary to pay too at once. The sum for residing at me was 170 euro for 3 days, I have paid the first days. My big troubles and hotel Giotto shame further have begun. To me have given out a room key, I have risen on the floor and have opened a room. Actually, I lived in different hotels and hostels from 1 star in Lisbon from 2 stars in Tokyo, but ANYWHERE (I underline, even in Japan where numbers simply microscopic, but improbably cozy) weren't the so worthlessly planned space. The daylight didn't get to a room AT ALL, number was so close that my suitcase didn't climb through in an aperture between a case and a bed. If I have seen this number on a photo at booking, I for what wouldn't go to this hotel, but Giotto have placed photos of spacious number with the big bed. In a reality it was similar to close hospital chamber in which there is on a bedside table an old lamp TV. It having appeared in number, I have understood that I don’t want to live in it. There it was impossible to be minutes. I left downwards to use FREE (as it has been specified on booking.com, now they have already corrected) wi-fi, BUT, by itself, have answered me that the Internet paid. All right, I have paid about 15 euro in an hour. Has then approached on a reception to warn that, possibly, tomorrow I will move down. On what the answer has been received: then pay one more days that have made book for 3 days and leave before term. Good - everything, everything if only to move down. Next morning hotel boy has literally partitioned off to me road and here the most interesting has begun. They couldn't understand among themselves in any way, in what number they have occupied me. Then it was found out that at me 2 (!) reservations through a site booking.com. That is one, on which I has driven also the second not cancelled. I PRECISELY knew that cancelled the first book. Besides, it has been confirmed by my account and the letter on mail!!! ANY SECOND RESERVATION was. But hotel boy hold the ground also in mandative tone has told to me to pay for days but not cancelled reservation. Yes, talked to me in mandative tone. There was a small probability that money nevertheless has come on a card and the employee of hotel has tried to pay to it an account part, but was refused. On what to me has been told: «Do you understand, it is ECONOMIC CRIME to specify number of an insolvent card at booking?» . Hear it – economic crime!!! But every clever person knows – you can pay by cash too. It’s really bad place even for 1 night. 70 euro for rudeness? No, thank you. Hotel Giotto is the worst way to spend money in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: marita_ew
Reviews.Content: the personal was very (!) rood and the room was VERY small and terrible. the bathrom - the best part of my number.

Reviews.Title: “we would go back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rakoskojohn
Reviews.Content: before we arrived at giotto , i had googled it. the reviews i'd read were mixed and in the main derogatory. we arrived with wheelchair as my knee was bad. we found that although the rooms are small we managed for space for the wheelchair. the hotel was cleaned every day. / continental breakfast was ok / rooms were not noisy. staff were very helpful. p.s. take a travel kettle with you. be very careful, look at price lists, 2 medium beers were 16euros. its a very expensive place is rome. The bus stop is a 5 min. leisurly walk and no 49 takes you to the entrance of the vatican museum & cistine chapel. at the terminus of no49 you get off and board [i think] the 85, this bus takes you to trevi fount and further on to coliceum. all in all giotto is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: bjstables
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here during June and overall the value for money was very good. Reception services were good - excellent English. When we had a slight problem with our room they did their best and moved us for the next 2 nights. Yes - sometimes a little noise from a large group but never too much. Good continental breakfast Access to the nearest Metro station (Battistini) was a 10 minute walk - or 3 minute walk fro the bus that goes straight to vatican city. From the metro station to the centre is only 20 minutes. Two other reviews on Tripadviser suggested the restaurant called Il Pizzicotta (turn left outside the hotel, go down the hill to the main road, turn left, cross over at the traffic lights and it's about 200m further along immediately after the petrol station) - the food is very good and the service very friendly (very little English!). We ate there every evening and it was always excellent value. As other reviews have said - don't be put off by the negativity of many reviews on here - we found it ideal for our weekend visit and very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: starmarie10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Giotto for 2 nights at the end of May 2011. As others have said it is not near the center of the city. You'll need a car to get anywhere. The hotel is in the middle of a neighborhood of very small roads with no parking. The hotel let us park in their small parking lot and we left the keys at the desk so they could move the car when they needed to. The air conditioner didn't work and I noticed other people staying there complained at the front desk about the air in their room too. We had to keep the windows open to get air and there is a cafe across the street which was quite loud. A house alarm went off in the middle of the night, waking us. The night staff spoke good English and they were nice to us (which was a rarity in Italy). The room was typical to this level of hotel in Italy...hard bed, flat pillows, detachable shower head. It was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, Cramped.”
Reviews.Author: krd91
Reviews.Content: When we booked the hotel we were told that the hotel was in walking distance of the centre of rome, and if you consider that it was not possible to get into the city without walking on dual carriage ways with no pedestrian walkway then i would argue it wasn't walkable, the taxis cost 15 euro just to get into town- and 15 back - and busses we couldnt get the hang of. The room was on the top floor of the hotel not acessable by a lift, the door of the room wouldn't even open without hitting the bed, the window was a frosted bathroom window so you couldn't see out not that you would want to (worst part of rome). The room had mould on the celing. The food was rubbish at breakfast and there is no facility to eat in the hotel at night. The staff were less than helpful and moaned at us when we told him we could only speak a little italian. WOULD NEVER GO BACK TO ROME spoiled my whole holiday and we paid extra to come home early.

Reviews.Title: “It was exactly what I was waiting for”
Reviews.Author: Agnes017
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small, but sweet. It was cleaned each day. The breakfast was cold and the same sortiment each day, but it was delicous and enough, you can eat as much you want. The coffee and fruit juice were coming from automatic machine, but were very good! The room and service was equivalent with its price. I was fully satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!! Cold coffee cold floors cold everything!!”
Reviews.Author: Noodles74
Reviews.Content: Im presently living in Germany. Was 3 days in Hotel Giotto..and never again will I go there! I was there with my 6 year old daughter and my partner. The rooms were so small and the shower was a joke! The water temperature was either too hot or too cold. The blow dryer was not worth while.. The worse was breakfast! I suggest rather go to Mac Donalds. The coffee was cold the rolls hard. The orange juice was horrible! We could hardly sleep at night because of the noise. The hotel personal were not very friendly. I suggest do not go there in winter you will freeze! The distance from Hotel to the next Metro station was too long (15min.) The only positive I can say is that the room service was ok - but when we got there, the floors were not so clean. For the price that we payed one can not expect alot, but at least a warm room!

Reviews.Title: “Definately NOT a 3 star hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: kayray15
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giotto, I am sorry to say, is a place I would not stay at again, or recommend to anyone! We checked into the hotel, staff weren't particulary friendly, We had booked and paid for a 'half board' package, but we were told there must have been a mistake, as the hotel did not have a restaurant. They did however, manage to secure dinner for a us at a local restaurant called Taverna Di Bacco, which by the way is lovely! Food is great and staff are very friendly. We then went up to our room, on the second floor, which was ABSOLUTELY TINY!! If we had been staying for just one or two nights, it would have been bearable, but me and my partner were staying for seven nights, in a tiny room with a very uncomfortable bed. The shower kept falling down, and it leaked all over the bathroom floor. The walls of the rooms must be very very thin, as I was kept awake one night by the man next door snoring! You could hear pretty much everything that next door were doing. The rooms however, were cleaned everyday, with new bed sheets and new towels etc. In the description of the hotel, it states it has a Bar, yes it does have a bar, which is NEVER open! So therefore there is nothing to really do in the evening, as the hotel is situated in the middle of nowhere! There is a little cafe opposite, but it looked at bit rough. I wouldn't feel comfortable going in there. Breakfast was OK, food wasn't fresh, nor was the coffee, tea tasted like toilet water! It was quite easy to get the bus into Rome city centre, the metro is about a 15 minute walk away, along busy roads with no pavement, so be careful at night! I think if you are planning a one/two night stay in this lovely city and you are not bothered about nightlife, Hotel Giotto is probably not a bad place to stay, and reasonably priced. I wish I had paid a bit extra and stayed somewhere a bit nicer, and somewhere where I would have felt a bit more welcome.

Reviews.Title: “If Rome wasn't great, I would be in serious trouble!”
Reviews.Author: fernandaseabra
Reviews.Content: Hotel Giotto is a disaster. Totally far away from all the city attractions AND metro stations ( Metro Batisttini is the closest station, BUT you will have to walk three blocks in a very dangerous Via Batisttini...walk carefully, because Roman drivers are a little crazy! ), you will probably have to take taxis more often than you would like to! The hotel website doesn't give real information about the place. The rooms are dirty and VERY small! I had to keep my suitcase under my bed! There is no wi-fi and the breakfast is very poor as well. Good things about Hotel Giotto? Cafe L'Insolito across the street saved my life! Patty and Faby, the owners of this place, offer a pasta+wine combo for 11 Euros and they are very friendly. You can also buy soft drinks, water, milk and potato chips to keep in your room! The hotel staff is also friendly! I was visiting Rome for the first time and spent the whole day walking through the city to get to know all the important places and we are talking about a big city here! I really wanted to go back to my hotel at the end of the day and sleep well, BUT it was impossible. There were groups of drunk teenagers staying there and they would spend the WHOLE night screaming and listening to loud music! Hotel Giotto didn't ruin my time in Rome, because the city is fantastic!!!!!If I was in a tedious place, I would have freaked out! Avoid Hotel Giotto...seriously!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at Hotel Giotto”
Reviews.Author: kittybeaches
Reviews.Content: We arrived about lunch time and were given the keys to the room without an explanation of services or even the time of breakfast. The hotel staff seemed quite miserable and quiet. Once we took the old 70s throwback elevator (if your scared of small spaces do not use the elevator!) we arrived on the fifth floor and arrived to a very basic room that was on the small side and although clean, we could instantly see numerous problems. The television was broken (we finally received a remote control on our fifth and last night), one of the blinds was broken so we could not open it (the blinds worked on a pull system), one of the plugs was hanging of the wall, the bathroom was a shower wet room, without a bath and to top it all off, the toilet leaked when you flushed it. I have stayed in five star hotels to three star and spent 6 years in the army sleeping in fields and I can definately say this hotel is not a three star. The breakfast was adequate but did not have fresh coffee or fruit. Considering there was a fruit stall next to the hotel and we are in Italy - home of coffee, I thought this was very poor. The hotel used a coffee machine to supply all guests with cold, awful tasting coffee. The location of the hotel is not next to a metro station (like stated), it is a 20 minute walk and for two young females it is a little daunting to walk on a busy road with no path. Yes the bus stop is a little closer but it is still a long way from the centre of Rome and the metro is more convienient. The hotel has potential to be alot better. All the hotel needs to do is open up the terrace (which looks abandoned) as there is not a place for guests to sit and relax, incorporate fresh food into the breakfast menu and update and fix amenities in the rooms. I felt as if the hotel staff were not interested in us and that they would rather not be working at the hotel. Very dissapointing!

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bhakti_11
Reviews.Content: we stayed here as part of a group tour. Upon arrival we were given our room keys and ours was on the top floor. we realised the lift didnt even go to this fllor, so we had to get off at the latest floor the lift got to (8 i think) and then walk another 2 flites of staris with our luggage to get to the room. when me and my partner entered out room we thought there had been a mistake as the room was clearly for a single person. i could tell from the layout, the headboard for a single bed, and the fact that the second single bed had been shoved into the room so the 2 beds didnt even line up, next to each other or the wall. I had to go over my partner to get out of bed. no place to put anything down, dusty room. moldy and tiny bathroom. when we went down to complain we ran into another couple from the tour who took were complaining abt their room. we went to see their room and the bathroom in their room was horrible. the shower was over the toliet!!! when we saw this we didnt bother complining abt our room. breakfast was poor, boring and not memorable. i dont even remember what I had, if anything. location is pretty bad, its like 50mins-1 hour away from rome city centre via metro and then a bus. nothing to do in the area, one bar across the road which closes at 9, nothing else open. there is a roof top u can access at the hotel, so our group just gathered there on the last nite having puchased some alcohol from the bar oppositie earlier and hung around there. it was noisy as when we left early to go to bed, we could hear them all.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms”
Reviews.Author: englandrugbyfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the England / Italy rugby match. Arrived at 1.30 am with friends and we were given a room on 6th floor. Our friends were on 5th floor. No lift to 6th floor and all room numbers start with 'P'. On entering our room we couldnt believe how small it was. The double bed was pushed right up against the wall and we had to pile our 2 small suitcases on top of each other on the chair. There really was NO room to swing a cat. Next morning at breakfast we asked our friends if we could see their room on 5th floor, and their room was MASSIVE compared to ours. My husband went to the reception and complained that we had paid the same price as our friends for a significantly inferior room. They said they would change our room whilst we were out during the day. We came back to a nice large room with a shower room that were both 3 - 4 times the size of our original room. Our advice is, don't accept a room on 6th floor, we believe they were possibly once staff quarters, and the wooden bedhead attached to the wall was only for a single bed. There was some noise, mainly young spanish school students, but this didn't go on too late, although my friend had to tell some of them to be quiet who were sitting outside her room on the floor talking. They did disperse and go to bed! The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from the tube station on the west side of the Vatican but we quickly got used to trekking back and forth over the 3 days, but as the hotel is not central, once you were out for the day we didn't go back until bed time. Personally I would prefer to be more central, but our trip was a reasonable price because of this location. The breakfasts were fine in the hotel, and the rooms and sheets very clean and tidy. The reception staff were fine too.

Reviews.Title: “feedback”
Reviews.Author: smcBucharest
Reviews.Content: I want to give you a feedback regarding my stay at this hotel last week. Almost everything was wrong from the first day. We had to wait in the lobby till 13.30 to have the check in made because the room was not ready. And the receptionist wasn’t nice at all. He apologized but he was nervous. Then, the room was so small and dirty. There was hair everywhere in the room and in the bathroom. I can’t understand why you have minibar in the room if it’s empty… The bathroom without a shower cabin was absolutely awful. One evening when we reach the room we found a dirty towel on the floor. There wasn’t ours. We also had problems with the card access to our room. Every time we had to try for 5 to 10 times to get into the room… In the morning, the chambermaid made a lot of noise because she was moving the beds and the chairs in the rooms from the same floor. It was annoying as we were in Rome for vacation. Regarding to the breakfast, it was so poor and not good at all. Every morning the same “food”. And the employees were slamming the dishes when they were cleaning the tables. This is not a sound you would like to hear in the morning. For conclusion, I can say we were very disappointed about our staying at Giotto Hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Really good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ninnypig
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel at the end of July 2009. It is situated quite far from the city centre, however is very accessable with the use of public transport. It is situated in a lovely little area close to local shops. The rooms were a fair size and very clean. Their was not much of a selection for breakfast but the food that was on offer was very appertising.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average”
Reviews.Author: Kazza0072009
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a tour group and arrived one day early as well. The hotel is a disaster the life is so small only one person and their suitcase could fit at a time and then they were the most indecisive lifts I've come across. The room was small, bed rock hard, fridge wasn't on and when we put it on it didn't work, the bathroom was a big flood with no shower curtain just a spout out of the wall meaning water went all over the toilet and sink and the first time I used it my dry clothes (we learnt the next day). Staff were rude although the breakfast staff were nice and tried to be of help. I wouldn't come back here if you paid me!

Reviews.Title: “Giotto never more”
Reviews.Author: Flaviobtu
Reviews.Content: This is not a serious hotel. How can they say that they are located "100 metres" away from the Vatican in the location section in their homepage??? It seems to me as a fake statement. And the reception workers? Far from friendly!! Considering this is a VERY FAR hotel from Roma Center, the staff should at least warn you about the last buses that come back to the hotel (last times!) and about Rome ridiculous metro schedule, which closes at 9 PM!!! Cornelia station also seem to be at least 500 metres away from the hotel. Not to comment the room, which was as small as it could be, and the shower, which also provided us with huge periods of COLD water during the shower. In resume, DO NOT BOOK IT unless you have to.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Curioustraveler81
Reviews.Content: We came from Tallinn, Estonia and stayed at this hotel for three nights, had a pleasant stay during this time. The hotel staff was friendly. This is a hotel with a quite good location, ca 5 min walk to the bus stop and 20-25 min drive to the center. We really enjoyed our stay, hope to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Squishy Rooms and Not Soundproof”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumStar
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a tour group there for three nights total and the rooms are very small. The management managed to squish four single beds into the room which left no room at all for any luggage, we were packed in like sardines. The bathroom shower is directlly over top the toilet, which makes it extremely hard to keep your towel dry in that small bathroom. The water pressure was very low also. The walls were not very soundproof and we could hear people in the room 2 rooms over very clearly. The actual hotel was very quaint with a unique layout. It had a pleasant feel to it and I felt secure there. Besides for being squished in and the very tiny bathroom, it wasn't that bad of a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Twinek
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at Hotel Giotto, which were pleasant and enjoyable. The staff were friendly and helpful. I advise any travellers to go to Battistini train station rather than Cornelia station ,as it is an easier walk and not continuously up hill and takes around 10-15 minutes walk. Found the hotel a little hard to find as side street is not clearly marked however if you take a map, there a many helpful locals who will point you in the right direction. Upon arrival we were informed that there were no twin rooms available so for our first night we would stay in singles. However, we were advised by our travel operator that Hotel Giotto allocates rooms upon arrival so we were not surprised. The next day the man at reception advised that our luggage would be moved to a twin room that day which it was upon our return. The hotel is clean and tidy and they have a luggage room if your flight is not until later in the day. Hotel Giotto is an affordable and excellent base to explore Rome, if you don't mind using the local Metro-net to get into the centre everyday, but at 11 euros for a 3 day travel pass who does. The only downside was the breakfast which is a cold buffet of cakes, bread, cheeses and ham. However there is a store next to the train station where you can grab something to eat. Overall i would highly recommend this hotel as affordable, clean and pleasant which offers a no frills stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto”
Reviews.Author: Erbngurl
Reviews.Content: I live in NYC and I have to say that, for traveling to another major city, I was very happy with the Hotel Giotto. As a Manhattanite, I see MANY tourists come in and out of my beloved city. Some are more comfortable doing what the masses do and staying where the masses stay. Times Square is just fine, but those in-the-know are quite cognizant of where the deeper, more cultural wonders of our city exist. Of COURSE, this experienced urban dweller wanted to see all of the tourist traps of Rome. But, I also wanted to do as the Romans do. Hotel Giotto was perfect for this. The hotel is outside of Rome proper, so to speak. I would sort of compare it to staying in Berkeley and traveling into San Fran, or staying in the very hip and posh areas of Williamsburg or Park Slope and traveling to Manhattan. We did everything by bus and train, which was completely accessible and near the hotel. It was so nice because the hotel's location was away from all the tourists - it was more "neighborhood" friendly - and if I were staying in Manhattan, I'd rather stay in the West Village than Times Square, which was a similar experience here. Giotto was located near better, more authentic restaurants (rather than the Hard Rock Rome), was in a quite neighborhood near a school, had a wonderful grocery store within walking distance and a nice, higher end gastronomia (for NYKERS a delicatessen) even closer. The gastronomia sold slices of authentic pizzas, inexpensive bottles of wine, cheese, crackers, Nutella, etc. It was perfect for stocking our hotel for times when we were hungry and places were closed (due to jet lag or during siestas). On to the facilities themselves. Everything was clean. The rooms ARE small. Seemed everything was smaller in Rome compared to the US thoughg: tiny cars, smaller portions of food, etc. I didn't mind because, again, everything in NYC (apartments, hotel rooms, space on the subways) except buildings and population is probably smaller than most places due to space. Plus, I was always out of the hotel. You're in Rome, get out and see it! When I was at the hotel, everything was modern and clean and the right size and space for what I needed. It had blackout shades to make the room nice and dark for siesta and when I was trying to get acclimated to the time change. The staff was so very helpful and friendly. One night, as we were leaving for dinner, one of the staff members chased us down to give us a bit of important information. His English was not so good, but he wanted to let us know that Alanis Morissette was playing a FREE concert outdoors in the Piazza del Popolo! So nice. I wouldn't have known otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Ricalqui
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for four nights in mid september. The location of the hotel is not the best, but a short distance (3 blocks) away there is a bus stop. The bus takes you to the center of Rome. The room was clean but too small. The buffet breakfast was fine and the staff cordial and helpful. The worst part of the room was the bathroom. You don't have enough space to take a shower and you are constantly bumping your elbows against the window that is one side of the shower stall. The shower stall was covered with mold. If I had to do it again, I would find a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: buburuza78
Reviews.Content: a quite good hotel, but not something special. the room is a bit smaller for 2 persons, but very clean, the curtain in the bathroom was dirty. breakfast was included, buffet, but not so much food. only non smoking rooms. :o( not so far from the metro station that can take you to the center of the city

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Culture_Vulture0161
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Giotto to celebrate our birthdays in January. The hotel was better than some and no worse than others we have stayed in. Yes the rooms are small and the bathroom shower was a challenge to even the best contortionist but we only needed a room for a base as we were out every day. The bus service was cheap and regular, just down the road and the train service was excellent. The buffet style continental breakfast was adequate and set us up till lunchtime. The little cafe over the road could have been a little more adventurous but the food was cooked fresh and was good. All in all you get what you pay for and we thought it was quite good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel long way from the city”
Reviews.Author: T-A-UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Top Deck tour, the hotel is not the easiest to find and is serviced by intermittent public transport. The room was small but clean but the shower was definately interesting as it was a shower head attached to the wall and then the drain was on the bathroom floor. It made the bathroom very slippery and somewhat dangerous. The breakfast was ok nothing flash but they did have fruit which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't Bad at All”
Reviews.Author: britpil
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for two nights. The room wasn't HUGE, but it did suffice for the four of us. The rooms were clean. The hotel itself overall was great, especially the roof. It was really nice up there at night, nice view of the city lights. Also, located directly across the street is a little cafe. The service there was excellent, as was the food & drink. We all had a great time there and certainly would go & stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but small”
Reviews.Author: Babyosa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was far from everything. It was clean but the shower was tiny. The breakfast they served was ok. You had to take a bus to the train or you could walk a 15 minute walk to the train. I don't think I will like to stay there again since it was so far from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: globe35
Reviews.Content: EXTREMELY BAD, BAD, BAD, BAD SERVICE!!!!!!! Don't ever visit Giotto hotel in Roma!!! I had the most terrible experience there. The bathroom door has locked and I've remained locked inside for about 40 minutes. I've pulled the S.O.S million of times, but instead of urgent reaction by the hotel staff, the receptionist has only phoned my room!!! Of course, due to the fact that there is no phone in the bathroom, I could not answer the phone and he didn't bother to come and check what happened. After 40 minutes and serial of screams for help, the receptionist eventually came and unlocked the door. Of course, no reimbursement was offered to me, neither it was granted on my request. Please, avoid the Giotto hotel to save your energy and money for the really worthy things in Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “hotel giotto....”
Reviews.Author: princes-sami
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a 2 day break at the hotel Giotto. Although the rooms are clean, they are extremly small and the walls are so thin..we got a early morning wake up call from the maids cleaning the bedrooms around us! This hotel is ideal for a short weekend break but take your hiking boots as you are quite a bit of a walk away from anything! The nearest shopping area, Cornelia is about half an hours walk away from the hotel and from here we used the metro quite often...1 euro for a single ticket which lasts 75 minutes. BEWARE!! crossing the roads in Rome is dangerous!!! Make sure to use the crossings otherwise you stand no chance!

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: chr15gb
Reviews.Content: My lady and I went for a long weekend in Rome. The hotel was difficult to find from the Rome Bus station even for the Taxi Driver, as much time spent map reading as driving! The first room (No 7) we were given was down a short flight of steps. I opened the door and didnt even stop, turned around, went back to reception and pushed the key back at the receptionist saying firmly NO!! The word Tiny does not do it justice. Two small beds almost at floor level. No view from window, no wardrobe, just a hanging rail. The receptionist apologised and said he could only move us to another small room (No 8) (but better than the first). The door to the second room could only be opened half way as it hit the bed. The wardrobe door could only be opened half way as it too hit the bed. Again No View from the window AT ALL, just the kitchen skylight. I walked through a door to see a toilet and sink, looked around and looked for another door for a bathroom (search didnt take long!) I looked back into the toilet room and above the toilet was a shower head!! To have a shower we had to remove the toilet roll from the holder to stop it getting wet and straddle the toilet to take a shower!! I had to shower first so I could coax out the cockroaches and get rid of them before my partner took her shower!! The second day they did move us to a decent room, air conditioned and quite satisfactory. There is nothing in walking distance to speak of. We found a Chinese restaurant and a little local restaurant, nothing else at all (the hotel doesn't do any food apart from breakfast). Nothing will make up for the outrageous first night and Wild Stallions wouldn't take me back to the hotel Giotto!! They can keep their cockroaches and pathetic rooms 7 and 8.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel if want a english speaking staff or help with tours”
Reviews.Author: ldavisdd
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean enough and the room was o.k. The staff spoke very little english and some none at all. They were of no help with attractions or restaurants. The hotel is to far out of the way and we were out a fortune on taxis. They advertised a tourist desk. Not that we saw. No maps, no brochures, nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Giotto, Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I had a short break in Rome stopping at the Giotto. The Hotel is clean and tidy with friendly staff. Breakfast is continental on a help yourself basis. The rooms are small and you get what you pay for. The big downer is the distance you need to travel. Do not believe that the Cornellia Metro station is only 200 metres away. After Cornellia Station you then need to walk about 500mtrs to the bus terminus where you catch a bus for 4 stops, then walk about another 500mtrs to the Hotel off the main road. There is a take away Pizza place, Chinese Restraunt and Pizza Restraunt within 10 minutes walking distance but that is about all! As I said, you get what you pay for, but my advice would be to pay a bit more and book into somewhere more central.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is clean and cheap...what more do you expect! Yes the rooms are really small, but they ARE cleaned daily to a good standard and everything worked. The bathroom is also tiny - the shower too - yes it can be difficult to bend over and wash ones feet!!! Recommend you ask for at least a first floor room...we were on reception level and had absolutely NO view from our window.. We found that Batastini Metro station was the easiest/closest to use - a good 10 minute walk. We never saw Cornelia, so can't comment on that. BEWARE - the metro stops running at 9pm. Breakfast was good, given the price of the accommodation - buffet style with as much coffee, croissant, ham + cheese rolls, fruit (tinned!) and cereal and fruit juice as you like. Would suggest, however, that you eat before returning to the hotel as there is really NOWHERE to eat - except a small take away pizzaria and an average Chinese restaurant. We found a really nice little bar just off one of the other streets on the piazza - the guy was really friendly and the local bottled beer was really good after a hot day's sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Grotti dont bother bookin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 300 metres from Cornelia Metro more like 300000! and all uphill. Upon arrival my husband and I were told that although we booked 5 months prior to our trip they only had two SINGLE rooms. We asked if they had a double as booked 'No sorry and the manager is on holiday. Don't worry we will give you a double room tomorrow and a bottle of wine and a little something to make up for your trouble'. We arrived back from our tour to find the same unhelpful man telling us that it was our mistake. Our room was like a shoe box I could clearly hear the man next door snoring. I would Not reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “new year break”
Reviews.Author: southernessIrvine
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during a new year break we had a great time the rooms were small but spotless all rooms were cleaned everyday and fresh towels put out for us everyday we were very impressed with hotel the breakfast was more than was expected there was three choices and you could have as much as you wanted the staff was pleasent and polite we will certainly be going back to the giotto hotelfeel free to ask about the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice - area not!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Giotto for 10 days in August and was pleasantly surprised by the rooms. They had been recently refurbished and were clean and spacious. The breakfast was a joke but thats the same with most continental breakfasts! There is nothing to do around the hotel as it is in a residential area but it is only 15 mins from the metro Cornelia (there is no need to get a bus as mentioned in review below). The hotel was very quiet and we didn't see any other british people there. I read on the website that there was a bar in the hotel but there wasn't. It is a good hotel as a base if you are there to see the daytime sights of Rome, but if you want nightlife and aren't prepared to pay a fortune in taxis then this isn't the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: KieronWood
Reviews.Content: My first night, they put me into the tiniest room I have ever seen in a hotel. A foot longer than the bed and about three feet wider. When I complained, I was moved to a slightly bigger room, but the shower was so small, I couldn't even reach to wash myself. The electricity also failed one night while I was there. The walls were so thin I could hear everything from the next room, and was kept awake by the guy's snoring! Someone else's bread and cheese was left in my mini-fridge. Breakfast was dreadful, except that the nice old guy who cleared the tables made me a cup of real coffee ever morning. It's miles from anywhere, at least half an hour on a crowded and irregular bus from the Vatican. There's a friendly restaurant nearby, Antica Roma, in Via Clemente III, but there's basically nothing to do in the area after about 9pm as everything is closed. Don't bother!

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overrated hotel, very far from the center of Rome, placed in a unfriendly zone. Small rooms with noysy a/c. No bath thoub or shower cabin, just a hole in the floor of the bathroom. Breakfast was a bad joke too. Almost ruined our stay in Rome

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Giotto
HotelInfo.Address: Via Cardinal Passionei 35, 00167 Rome, Italy
